plugins.name: Color Ramp Generator
plugins.description:
Introducing the Color Ramp Generator plugin - designed to streamline your workflow and ensure accessibility across all your designs. This tool allows you to generate a color ramp from any HEX color you provide, ensuring each color meets predefined contrast ratios for accessibility.


Simply enter your HEX code (with or without the “#”), give it a name and the plugin will automatically generate a 15-color gradient. It adjusts the lightness to meet the exact contrast ratios, while preserving the hue and saturation of your colors.


This color system integrates accessibility directly into your design process. In my past projects, clients often provided incomplete brand guidelines, especially regarding accessibility. To solve this, I created a method to generate accessible color ramps, assigning each shade a number for easy reference. I specifically built this system to support white-labeling requirements, enabling quick and easy customization for different brands while maintaining accessibility standards.


Each color in the palette is numbered from 5 to 100, with the darkest color assigned “5” and the brightest color assigned “100.”


Here’s the key feature: a points-based color system.

• A 40-point difference between shades meets a 3:1 contrast ratio.

• A 50-point difference meets a 4.5:1 ratio.

• A 60-point difference meets a 7:1 ratio.


This system allows you to easily achieve AA and AAA accessibility standards by assigning colors to objects accordingly.


Cross-Palette Accessibility: This feature ensures that colors from different palettes are also accessible when combined. For example, Color 30 from one palette and Color 80 from another palette will automatically have a 50-point difference, which meets the 4.5:1 contrast ratio requirement. This makes it easy to mix colors from different palettes while maintaining accessibility.


The output generated is clean and ready for use in your design system, ensuring that your designs not only meet accessibility standards but also look polished and professional.


With this system, you can reduce your toolkit setup time from days to under a minute, saving 99% of the time.
plugins.tagline: Create color shades to establish a color system.

- Minor bug fixes.

plugins.name: Text Repeat Grid
plugins.description:
Introducing the "Text Repeat Grid" Plugin for Figma


This plug-in was primarily created to make working with tables and repeating elements / grid layouts with text a lot easier and faster. However you can use it for many other things as well, like e.g. copying text from a group to a component (using the “Get Text From Selection” feature) and pasting it to a component or vice versa, create variations by randomizing table column data etc.


In conjunction with Figma core features, it provides a replacement for the amazing Adobe XD “Repeat Grid” feature.


Hopefully this plug-in will revolutionize the way you manage text in your designs. Here's how it can help you streamline your workflow:


Manual Input & Text File Upload

- Whether you're typing directly into the text input field or uploading a text file, this feature allows you to populate selected text frames quickly. Simply enter your text or upload a file, and each line of text will be automatically distributed to your selected text frames in the order they appear in the layers panel.

* Create realistic layouts by using text that makes sense

* Use your favourite software or AI chat bot to create content

* Each line will be filled in a separate text layer of your current selection

* e.g. user names, dates, locations, headlines, labels, tags etc.


Spreadsheet Input

Need to fill a table like-structure? The spreadsheet feature lets you drag and drop a spreadsheet file to fill text frames across multiple columns and rows simultaneously. Just remember, your text frames need to be organized in a table-like structure in Figma – think of nesting your text cells in rows or columns. Make sure you select all related columns or rows before applying the text.

You can select between a column-first and a row-first structure to fill the data according to your layer architecture.


This feature shines in scenarios like setting up a multi-field form or a dashboard where data is organized in grids. It ensures that each piece of data lands exactly where it's supposed to, across both rows and columns, saving you the hassle of manual entry.


Randomize Input

With a simple toggle, you can randomize the order of your text inputs. This is particularly useful when you want to experiment with different orders, create variations, or make the same data not look repetitive, without rearranging text manually.


Get Text from Selection

If you need to repurpose or edit text already placed in your designs, this feature makes it a breeze. Just select the text frames you want to edit, and the plugin will pull the text from each frame, allowing you to quickly make changes or redistribute the text.

* Use as copy & paste from many to many text layers

* Translation: Quickly copy text, translate in your favourite tool and paste it back


Why You'll Love It: "Text Repeat Grid" not only enhances your productivity but also integrates seamlessly into your design process, allowing you more time to focus on creativity and less on repetitive tasks.


So, ready to speed up your design process? Give "Text Repeat Grid" a try and watch your efficiency soar!
plugins.tagline: Fill any number of text layers from input, txt file or spreadsheet. Lightning fast tables, grids ...

plugins.name: Wormhole Tunnels
plugins.description:
Looking for a plugin that can help you generate round tunnels?


Introducing Wormhole Tunnels!


How it works:

  1. Open the Wormhole Tunnels plugin.
  2. Play with these parameters:
  3. Twist/Spiral (Range: 0-360)
  4. Contraction/Expansion (Range: 0-100)
  5. Radial Lines (Range: 5-50)
  6. Concentric Rings (Range: 5-30)
  7. Depth/Stretch (Range: 0-200)
  8. Warp/Distortion (Range: 0-100)
  9. Adjust the stroke width and color, and click on "Generate".
  10. Your pattern is ready!


NO login/signup required!


Feel free to reach out in case of any doubts, bugs or new feature improvements!
plugins.tagline: A plugin that helps you generate wormhole tunnels from any shape!

105516.name: Wormhole Tunnels

105516.tagline: A plugin that helps you generate wormhole tunnels from any shape!

plugins.name: JACoB: AI CodeGen Connector
plugins.description: Transform your Figma designs into React components effortlessly with JACoB: CodeGen Connector. This plugin bridges the gap between design and development by enabling a direct connection to your GitHub repositories with the JACoB GitHub bot. Simply authenticate with GitHub, link your repos, and select design elements in Figma. Provide additional instructions if needed, and with a single click, initiate the automated code generation process in GitHub. JACoB's AI-driven technology ensures the generated React code aligns with your project's style and framework, streamlining your development workflow. Note: JACoB requires a subscription for the GitHub bot integration.
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly Convert Figma Designs to Production-Level React Code Directly to GitHub PRs

84289.name: JACoB: AI CodeGen Connector
84289.description: Transform your Figma designs into React components effortlessly with JACoB: CodeGen Connector. Provide additional instructions if needed, and with a single click, initiate the automated code generation process in GitHub. JACoB's AI-driven technology ensures the generated React code aligns with your project's style and framework, streamlining your development workflow. Note: JACoB requires a subscription for the GitHub bot integration.

plugins.name: MP Asset Generator
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to update the styles and logos of Marriage Pact assets to reuse your design for other colleges. Aside from creating two components and changing paint styles, this plugin will not mutate your Figma file in any way.


Colors

Your file should already have color styles with a hierarchy relatively like "[Print/Digital/Text] > [Primary/Secondary]". If not, clicking any colored square should initialize them with the appropriate brand colors.


Logo

When clicking "Update Logo", the plugin looks for the group "Logos/Editable Digital Logo" on the first page and creates (or updates) the components "Digital Logo" and "Print Logo", which are scalable copies of whatever lies in Editable Digital Logo.


If your file doesn't have any such component, "Update Logo" will display an error in the plugin, and no action will be taken.


---

If you have any questions, feel free to contact jerryh2@stanford.edu.

21028.description:

plugins.name: Lilly Icon - Free Rive Animated & Static Icons
plugins.description:
What is Lilly Icon?

Lilly Icon is a free and growing collection of static and Rive animated icons. With this Figma plugin, you can easily insert static icons into your designs. For development phase, animated Rive (.riv) versions are available on the Lilly Icon website to bring your projects to life.


Is it really free?

Yes—completely free! No paywalls or sign-ups. All icons are licensed under Creative Commons BY 4.0, including the animated ones.


Thanks to your donations, Lilly keeps expanding with more icons and new features.


Created and maintained with love by Sajjad Dashti — graphic, product, and motion designer.

Questions? Reach out at hi@sajjaddashti.ir.
plugins.tagline: Add static Lilly icons to Figma designs with quick search and easy insert.

plugins.name: Varcraft – Find, Replace & Detach Variables
plugins.description:
Varcraft is a beautifully simple Figma plugin. Quickly find, detach, and replace variables in your designs—streamline your workflow in just a click.


How it works

  1. Select your object or frame.
  2. Instantly see all applied variables and their types.
  3. Choose which variables to detach or replace—simple and done!


Key features:

🆕 Easy Replacement: Replace variables across multiple layers or components.

🔎 Instant Search: Quickly find the exact variables you need.

🪄 Automation: Instantly analyzes your selection, showing results in seconds.

💡 Variable Overview: Clearly shows all variables and their types.

🎯 Precision Detachment: Accurately detach variables without affecting your designs.

🖍 Error Detection: Highlights missing or broken variable links, keeping your projects error-free.

☑️ Complexity Simplified: Easily handles nested layers and complex components, making your designs simpler to manage.


⚠️ Note: Doesn't support Effects variables (yet!).

accepted.name: Pecherin Maxim
accepted.description: Frontend developer obsessed with Figma plugins 🧠💡✨

plugins.tagline: An easy way to remove applied variables.

plugins.name: Beautiful Time
plugins.description: The Ratio symbol — Unicode character 2236 — is used between hours, minutes, and seconds in time. Do not use a colon (:) which is vertically aligned to the baseline, and will appear to sit low compared to the adjacent digits. Ratio (∶) is vertically centered between the baseline and the cap height.
plugins.tagline: Design details make the difference

plugins.name: Copy Paste Styled Text
plugins.description:
Copying text into Figma shouldn’t mean losing your formatting.


🌎 Problem We Solve —

When you directly copy and paste text from the web into Figma, it usually loses its structure—everything gets flattened into a single, unformatted block of text.


🚀 Our Solution —

With this plugin, your text stays formatted exactly as it should—headings, bullet points, code styling, you name it—it all remains intact. No more reformatting by hand. Our plugin seamlessly handles styles for:

  1. headings
  2. subheadings
  3. bullet points & lists
  4. code snippets
  5. font weights
  6. bold & italics


🌱 Get the most out of this plugin with ChatGPT —

This also works seamlessly with text documents generated in ChatGPT, Claude, DeepSeek, Gemini, Mistral, Llama, or your favorite LLM of choice.

Whether you're drafting a quick project scope outline or developer handoff notes, simply copy and paste it from your LLM into Figma using this plugin, and your structured document will remain perfectly intact—ready to use without extra formatting effort.


P.S. If you found this plugin useful, check out more of our free resources on our Bento. For updates on new releases, follow @redwood.ux on Instagram!


🍊 Find us online!

  1. Instagram: @redwood.ux
  2. Website: redwoodux.com
  3. Kofi: ko-fi.com/redwoodux
  4. Bento: bento.me/redwoodux
plugins.tagline: Preserve your text formatting when you copy-paste text from the web into Figma

plugins.name: Datapaw (AI, Google Sheets, JSON, API, String, Currency, Number, Fake Data, and more)
plugins.description:
Generate realistic data exactly how you want it.

All-in-one data generation tools in a single plugin.


Datapaw helps designers populate their contents with meaningful, customizable data. Instead of using generic placeholder text like lorem ipsum, you can generate production-like data that you provide to enhances the realism of your designs.


Rich feature in every data type


📊 JSON

  1. Import content instantly via direct input or URL
  2. Add 🏞️ images and 🎨 color (HEX & RGB) to your layers
  3. Process complex nested JSON content with ease
  4. Navigate JSON data through tree view or directly to the value
  5. Control content order from random, as entered, or reverse order
  6. Lock unwanted layers for precise generation 🔒


🤖 Artificial Intelligence (AI)

  1. Instantly generate text & content for your Figma designs with AI
  2. Bring Your Own Key (BYOK), full control of your API key 🔑
  3. Supports OpenAI (others coming soon, fully pluggable architecture)
  4. Configure advanced prompts and generation settings 🎛️
  5. Add AI-generated content to text layers, components, and more


🏓 Google Sheets

  1. Import from the URL of Your Google Sheets
  2. All features in JSON can be done for this data type


🌐 API

  1. Seamlessly generate data from public or private APIs!
  2. Support for dynamic path variables, query parameters, you can now integrate API data into your workflows like never before.


📖 Multi Variable Data

  1. Generate customized data and connect it with variables 🎢
  2. Imagine a product card that uses REALISTIC data that you can easily control


💬 String, Number, Percent, Image, Data & Time, Currency

  1. Set your data EXACTLY as you want it, from min and max ranges to currency symbols, prefixes, suffixes, and others
  2. Control content order from random, as entered, or reverse order


💥 Fake Data

  1. Generate dummy data 📈 for full names, phone numbers, addresses, and more
  2. Available for English, Japanese, Indonesian, and Chinese (China) data


✄ - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -


Not only that, there is still more


🔑 Others Features

  1. Privacy First: All configurations saved locally–your data stays yours.
  2. Layer Freedom: Generate for single or multiple layers with just a few clicks.
  3. Easy Backup: Export and import your configurations between devices.


💪 Supported Data Types

  1. AI NEW
  2. JSON NEW
  3. Google Sheets NEW
  4. API NEW
  5. String (for all your text needs)
  6. Number (with flexible formatting)
  7. Percent
  8. Image
  9. Multi Variable (for complex, interconnected data)
  10. Fake Data (realistic, production-like data)
  11. Date & Time
  12. Currency
  13. …and more coming soon!


💎 Simple Pricing

Try it out with 12 free generations per Figma file, or unlock unlimited access with a one-time payment of $10.


🐞 Got ideas or found a bug?

Comment or contact me in Threads. Your feedback helps make this plugin even better for everyone!


👍 Like this? Tip me at coff.ee/afnizarnur
plugins.tagline: Generate realistic data exactly how you want it. From AI, Google Sheets, JSON, API, and more.

138653.name: Datapaw (AI, Google Sheets, JSON, API, String, Currency, Number, Fake Data, and more)
138653.description:
Generate realistic data exactly how you want it.

All-in-one data generation tools in a single plugin.


Datapaw helps designers populate their contents with meaningful, customizable data. Instead of using generic placeholder text like lorem ipsum, you can generate production-like data that you provide to enhances the realism of your designs.


Rich feature in every data type


📊 JSON

  1. Import content instantly via direct input or URL
  2. Add 🏞️ images and 🎨 color (HEX & RGB) to your layers
  3. Process complex nested JSON content with ease
  4. Navigate JSON data through tree view or directly to the value
  5. Control content order from random, as entered, or reverse order
  6. Lock unwanted layers for precise generation 🔒


🤖 Artificial Intelligence (AI)

  1. Instantly generate text & content for your Figma designs with AI
  2. Bring Your Own Key (BYOK), full control of your API key 🔑
  3. Supports OpenAI (others coming soon, fully pluggable architecture)
  4. Configure advanced prompts and generation settings 🎛️
  5. Add AI-generated content to text layers, components, and more


🏓 Google Sheets

  1. Import from the URL of Your Google Sheets
  2. All features in JSON can be done for this data type


🌐 API

  1. Seamlessly generate data from public or private APIs!
  2. Support for dynamic path variables, query parameters, you can now integrate API data into your workflows like never before.


📖 Multi Variable Data

  1. Generate customized data and connect it with variables 🎢
  2. Imagine a product card that uses REALISTIC data that you can easily control


💬 String, Number, Percent, Image, Data & Time, Currency

  1. Set your data EXACTLY as you want it, from min and max ranges to currency symbols, prefixes, suffixes, and others
  2. Control content order from random, as entered, or reverse order


💥 Fake Data

  1. Generate dummy data 📈 for full names, phone numbers, addresses, and more
  2. Available for English, Japanese, Indonesian, and Chinese (China) data


✄ - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -


Not only that, there is still more


🔑 Others Features

  1. Privacy First: All configurations saved locally–your data stays yours.
  2. Layer Freedom: Generate for single or multiple layers with just a few clicks.
  3. Easy Backup: Export and import your configurations between devices.


💪 Supported Data Types

  1. AI NEW
  2. JSON NEW
  3. Google Sheets NEW
  4. API NEW
  5. String (for all your text needs)
  6. Number (with flexible formatting)
  7. Percent
  8. Image
  9. Multi Variable (for complex, interconnected data)
  10. Fake Data (realistic, production-like data)
  11. Date & Time
  12. Currency
  13. …and more coming soon!


💎 Simple Pricing

Try it out with 12 free generations per Figma file, or unlock unlimited access with a one-time payment of $10.


🐞 Got ideas or found a bug?

Comment or contact me in Threads. Your feedback helps make this plugin even better for everyone!


👍 Like this? Tip me at coff.ee/afnizarnur

plugins.name: Skeleton Themes
plugins.description:
Effortlessly manage, import, and delete themes as Figma Variables, directly from the Skeleton v3 Theme Creator to the Skeleton Figma UI Kit. Streamline your workflow, maintain consistency, and easily customize your UI designs.


Precondition:

Skeleton v3 Figma UI Kit


Guides:

  1. Set-Up Skeleton v3 Figma UI Kit:
  2. Ensure you have the Skeleton v3 Figma UI Kit installed. This is essential for using the plugin, as it integrates directly with the kit’s components and styles.
  3. How to use Skeleton Themes Plugin:
  4. Import your custom themes directly from the Skeleton v3 Theme Creator.
  5. Manage and edit themes within Figma, syncing styles instantly across your projects.
  6. Delete outdated or unused themes to keep your Figma workspace organized.


Note:

Only compatible with Skeleton v3.
plugins.tagline: Simplify theme handling with powerful Figma Variable integration.

126838.name: Skeleton Themes
126838.description:
Effortlessly manage, import, and delete themes as Figma Variables, directly from the Skeleton v3 Theme Creator to the Skeleton Figma UI Kit. Streamline your workflow, maintain consistency, and easily customize your UI designs.


Precondition:

Skeleton v3 Figma UI Kit


Guides:

  1. Set-Up Skeleton v3 Figma UI Kit:
  2. Ensure you have the Skeleton v3 Figma UI Kit installed. This is essential for using the plugin, as it integrates directly with the kit’s components and styles.
  3. How to use Skeleton Themes Plugin:
  4. Import your custom themes directly from the Skeleton v3 Theme Creator.
  5. Manage and edit themes within Figma, syncing styles instantly across your projects.
  6. Delete outdated or unused themes to keep your Figma workspace organized.


Note:

Only compatible with Skeleton v3.
126838.tagline: Simplify theme handling with powerful Figma Variable integration.

plugins.name: Old-school Prototyping
plugins.description:
Before Figma, we had an effective method of presenting design mockups to clients. Creating an HTML page and embedding the mockup directly at the center of the page. This method not only allowed us to showcase our designs in a clear and focused manner but also provided a straightforward way for clients to visualize the final product within a web context.


Features:


  • Retro-styled mockup presentation for a classic prototyping experience.


  • Easy replication of horizontal backgrounds with a 1px repeating background image.


  • Downloaded zip file includes a collection of mockup pages(index.html) with links to individual pages.


  • Lightweight and efficient, ensuring smooth integration into modern workflows.


  • Offers a nostalgic yet practical approach to design presentations.


  • A must-have for aficionados of vintage design aesthetics. :)


Here's how you can contribute:

A quick and easy way to show your appreciation for this plugin is by buying me a coffee. This one-time contribution fuels my passion and helps maintain the development of the plugin.


https://www.buymeacoffee.com/lucksy


Happy Prototyping!

accepted.name: Amila Sampath
accepted.description: Hi, I'm Amila. I design & build user interfaces.

plugins.tagline: Simple prototyping tool that setup HTML pages of your designs with background image and color

plugins.name: Resize from
plugins.description:
Resize from is inspired by a feature of other design tools that lets you resize things in different directions (besides from the top-left) simply by typing a dimension followed by the letter: c(enter), l(eft), r(ight), t(op) or b(ottom).


Plans for next steps…

  • Keyboard nudge amounts, proportional resizing, more…

accepted.name: Graham Sysko
accepted.description: 👋🏼 I am a designeer @ Zendesk who likes making (mostly internal) Figma plugins.

plugins.tagline: Resize from lets you resize things in different directions (besides from the top-left)

44246.name: Resize from
44246.description:
Resize from is inspired by a feature of other design tools that lets you resize things in different directions (besides from the top-left) simply by typing a dimension followed by the letter: c(enter), l(eft), r(ight), t(op) or b(ottom).


Plans for next steps…

  • Keyboard nudge amounts, proportional resizing, more…
44246.release_notes: Add support for design file Sections.
44246.tagline: Resize from lets you resize things in different directions (besides from the top-left)

plugins.name: AI Icon Finder
plugins.description:
AI Icon Finder is a powerful Figma plugin that helps designers quickly find the perfect icons using natural language. Simply describe what you're looking for, and our AI will interpret your query and locate the most relevant icons instantly.


How It Works


  1. Type a description of the icon you need (e.g., "payment confirmation" or "shopping cart with items")
  2. Click "Search" and watch as AI interprets your query into relevant keywords
  3. AI Interpreted queries are clickable and using as a search element for better linking over results
  4. Browse the results and preview icons before inserting
  5. Insert directly into your design or copy the SVG with one click
plugins.tagline: AI-powered icon search that understands even the most abstract prompts.

123465.name: AI Icon Finder
123465.description:
AI Icon Finder is a powerful Figma plugin that helps designers quickly find the perfect icons using natural language. Simply describe what you're looking for, and our AI will interpret your query and locate the most relevant icons instantly.


How It Works


  1. Type a description of the icon you need (e.g., "payment confirmation" or "shopping cart with items")
  2. Click "Search" and watch as AI interprets your query into relevant keywords
  3. AI Interpreted queries are clickable and using as a search element for better linking over results
  4. Browse the results and preview icons before inserting
  5. Insert directly into your design or copy the SVG with one click

networkAccess.reasoning: The plugin needs to fetch icons from various icon providers and uses AI services to process search queries. Different users may configure different AI services that require access to different domains.

123465.tagline: AI-powered icon search that understands even the most abstract prompts.

plugins.name: WaveMaker AutoCode
plugins.description:
Convert Figma Designs that use popular UI Kits such as Material 3.0 into code. Furthermore the generated code can be easily edited in WaveMaker studio. Binding to backend APIs, customizing the pages with business logic is a cinch.


Apart from Figma design screens becoming pages in your app, the design token variables, and mode from Figma are also translated in the WaveMaker UI Kit. This powers the pixel-perfect translation of designs but also enables customization of the look and feel using the design tokens editor in WaveMaker studio.
plugins.tagline: Convert Figma Designs that use popular UI Kits such as Material 3.0 into Angular code.

136573.name: WaveMaker AutoCode
136573.description:
Convert Figma Designs that use popular UI Kits such as Material 3.0 into code. Furthermore the generated code can be easily edited in WaveMaker studio. Binding to backend APIs, customizing the pages with business logic is a cinch.


Apart from Figma design screens becoming pages in your app, the design token variables, and mode from Figma are also translated in the WaveMaker UI Kit. This powers the pixel-perfect translation of designs but also enables customization of the look and feel using the design tokens editor in WaveMaker studio.
136573.release_notes:
Better UI, Bug Fixes, and Improved Support for Larger Screens

Table enhancements: Added support for subtext, avatars, and pagination
Left navigation: Now adapts its height class based on whether the page content is scrollable

Breadcrumbs: Now supports two display variants
-Labels and icons
-Icons only

Segmented buttons: Now supports three display variants:
-Labels only
-Labels with icons
-Icons only

Screen size support: Improved layout rendering for wide screens

Additional CSS bug fixes for improved consistency and rendering
136573.tagline: Convert Figma Designs that use popular UI Kits such as Material 3.0 into Angular code.

plugins.name: Tooltipo
plugins.description:
Create beautifully designed tooltips in seconds with Tooltip Generator! This plugin streamlines your workflow by offering real-time preview and comprehensive customization options. Perfect for UI designers, design system maintainers, and anyone looking to add consistent tooltips to their designs.


Detailed Features

• Live Preview: See your tooltip changes in real-time as you customize

• Multiple Positions: Choose from top, right, bottom, or left positioning

• Full Customization: Control colors, padding, font size, corner radius, and pointer size

• Color Control: Use color picker or input hex codes directly

• Auto-Layout Ready: All tooltips are created with auto-layout for easy integration

• Clean Output: Organized layers with proper naming and structure

• Dark Theme UI: Comfortable interface that matches Figma's dark theme

• Single-Click Creation: Generate your tooltip instantly with one click


How to Use

1. Set your tooltip text

2. Customize colors using the color picker or hex inputs

3. Choose the pointer position (top, right, bottom, or left)

4. Adjust size settings if needed (padding, font size, corner radius, pointer)

5. Preview your changes in real-time

6. Click "Create Tooltip" to add it to your design
plugins.tagline: A simple way to generate auto-layout tooltips with custom styling and positioning

110519.name: Tooltipo
110519.description:
Create beautifully designed tooltips in seconds with Tooltip Generator! This plugin streamlines your workflow by offering real-time preview and comprehensive customization options. Perfect for UI designers, design system maintainers, and anyone looking to add consistent tooltips to their designs.

• Auto-Layout Ready: All tooltips are created with auto-layout for easy integration

5. Preview your changes in real-time

6. Click "Create Tooltip" to add it to your design
110519.tagline: A simple way to generate auto-layout tooltips with custom styling and positioning

plugins.name: Reverse layers position
plugins.description: To reverse the position order of layers with a single click, this script can help. If you need to reflect layers horizontally across the X-axis, simply select two or more layers and press the action button. The plugin will rearrange the layers' positions like a mirror.
plugins.tagline: Reverse layers position order in one click.

86997.name: Reverse layers position
86997.description: To reverse the position order of layers with a single click, this script can help. If you need to reflect layers horizontally across the X-axis, simply select two or more layers and press the action button. The plugin will rearrange the layers' positions like a mirror.
86997.tagline: Reverse layers position order in one click.

plugins.name: ColorVariable Inspector
plugins.description:
ColorVariable Inspector

allows designers and design system content creators to list all the color variables in its different variable modes (light mode, dark mode, …) and its color variable aliases for a selected layer.


It helps to better understand a complex system of nested variable aliases and variables from different variable collections.
plugins.tagline: A plugin to inspect a layer's color variable(s)

81662.name: ColorVariable Inspector
81662.description:
ColorVariable Inspector

allows designers and design system content creators to list all the color variables in its different variable modes (light mode, dark mode, …) and its color variable aliases for a selected layer.


It helps to better understand a complex system of nested variable aliases and variables from different variable collections.

networkAccess.reasoning: No network access needed for the plugin.

81662.release_notes: Added plugin support for Dev Mode and Figma for VS Code
81662.tagline: A plugin to inspect a layer's color variable(s)

plugins.name: rm-half-leading
plugins.description:
Erase the extra top and bottom margins of the selected text.

Japanese fonts is also supported.
plugins.tagline: Remove half leading of texts.

61090.name: rm-half-leading
61090.description:
Erase the extra top and bottom margins of the selected text.

Japanese fonts is also supported.

plugins.name: Share links
plugins.description:
Hot it works


1. Copy one link to the necessary file.

2. Select a frame or multiple frames, or even a section with frames.

3. Choose settings if needed and click the "Copy to clipboard" button.


Done! You get the structured list of section and frame links.
plugins.tagline: Quickly share multiple frame links with just a few clicks

67230.name: Share links
67230.description:
Hot it works


1. Copy one link to the necessary file.

2. Select a frame or multiple frames, or even a section with frames.

3. Choose settings if needed and click the "Copy to clipboard" button.


Done! You get the structured list of section and frame links.
67230.release_notes: The "Share link" field has been added to obtain the file ID.
67230.tagline: Quickly share multiple frame links with just a few clicks

plugins.name: Bluebrint Plugin
plugins.description:
Sync your design with Blueprint


Steps:

  1. Select a frame. The frame is going to be synchronized.
  2. Click "EXPORT" button. It will opens Blueprint in Web browser.
  3. Select a Blueprint project.
  4. Accept the consent screen. Blueprint requires READ permissions of the Figma file.
  5. You are ready to refer the frame from Blueprint!
plugins.tagline: Boost your design oriented development process.

45731.name: Bluebrint Plugin
45731.description:
Sync your design with Blueprint


Steps:

  1. Select a frame. The frame is going to be synchronized.
  2. Click "EXPORT" button. It will opens Blueprint in Web browser.
  3. Select a Blueprint project.
  4. Accept the consent screen. Blueprint requires READ permissions of the Figma file.
  5. You are ready to refer the frame from Blueprint!
45731.tagline: Boost your design oriented development process.

plugins.name: Affinity Cluster
plugins.description:
An Affinity Cluster is a component in Figma that clearly marks a section with a title.


Features:


  • Generate a cluster above your selection.
  • Resize the top-most Affinity Cluster in your selection to match the width of the rest of your selection
plugins.tagline: Clearly mark sections in your Figma and Figjam files

91988.name: Affinity Cluster
91988.description:
An Affinity Cluster is a component in Figma that clearly marks a section with a title.


Features:


  • Generate a cluster above your selection.
  • Resize the top-most Affinity Cluster in your selection to match the width of the rest of your selection
91988.tagline: Clearly mark sections in your Figma and Figjam files

plugins.name: Type Tokens
plugins.description:
How to use:


  1. Open the plugin in the playground file
  2. Copy the type token component to your file (do not change the component hierarchy or layer names)
  3. Using an instance of the component apply your type style to the "Example Text".
  4. Run the plugin and the numbers will be automatically populated to all variants of the component on the current page.


Note: Currently it does not work when type style line-heights are set to auto. Also it will intentionally ignore populating "Font Size" on instances that have the word "clamp" written in them.
plugins.tagline: Document all of your type styles in one place

110689.name: Type Tokens
110689.description:
How to use:


  1. Open the plugin in the playground file
  2. Copy the type token component to your file (do not change the component hierarchy or layer names)
  3. Using an instance of the component apply your type style to the "Example Text".
  4. Run the plugin and the numbers will be automatically populated to all variants of the component on the current page.


Note: Currently it does not work when type style line-heights are set to auto. Also it will intentionally ignore populating "Font Size" on instances that have the word "clamp" written in them.
110689.release_notes: Updated community file, and added support for auto populating title with style name
110689.tagline: Document all of your type styles in one place

plugins.description: If you're looking to emphasize specific layers, simply name them identically (or use similar names), and this plug-in will automatically apply an eye-catching highlight to those layers for you.

74348.name: Highlight Layers
74348.description: If you're looking to emphasize specific layers, simply name them identically (or use similar names), and this plug-in will automatically apply an eye-catching highlight to those layers for you.
74348.release_notes: It's now possible to set border color, width and padding

plugins.name: StreamText AI
plugins.description:
This plugin transforms your text layers into dynamic animations, mimicking the response styles of AI tools like ChatGPT, Perplexity, and Claude. With just one click, you can export these animations to elevate your designs and showcase real-life AI interactions. Perfect for designers working on AI tools and features, this plugin unlocks new creative potential, empowering you to present innovative concepts effortlessly.

plugins.name: Export to WebP
plugins.description:
Export to WebP transforms your Figma frames into optimised WebP images with just a few clicks.


WebP offers significantly smaller file sizes compared to PNG while maintaining excellent visual quality - perfect for web projects where performance matters.


Key Features


Smart Target File Size Optimisation ✨ NEW

•Set your desired file size (e.g., "100 KB" or "2 MB") and let the plugin automatically find the perfect quality setting

•Advanced binary search algorithm optimises quality to hit your exact target size

•Real-time progress feedback shows optimisation iterations

•Perfect for meeting specific file size requirements or bandwidth constraints

⠀

Advanced Transparency Control ✨ NEW

•Preserve or remove alpha channel (transparency) based on your needs

•Keep transparent backgrounds for overlays and UI elements

•Remove transparency for smaller file sizes when opacity isn't needed

•Smart default settings optimize for most common use cases


Efficient WebP Conversion

•Convert any Figma element to WebP format with high-quality results

•Save up to 30-75% in file size compared to PNG format

•Maintain visual quality while dramatically reducing file sizes


Flexible Quality Settings

•Choose from preset quality options (High Quality, Web Optimised, Ultra Compressed)

•Fine-tune compression with a precise quality slider (0-100%)

•Create and save custom quality presets for your specific needs


Batch Processing

•Convert multiple elements simultaneously

•Real-time progress tracking with accurate completion estimates

•Optimised memory usage for handling large selections


Export Options

•Save as a single ZIP file containing all WebP images

•Download individual WebP files directly

•Automatic naming based on your Figma layer structure


Detailed Statistics

•View before/after file size comparisons

•See exact file size savings for each conversion

•Track total compression savings across your selection


Simple Workflow

•Select elements → Choose quality → Convert → Download

•Integrates seamlessly with your Figma workflow

•Works with frames, components, groups, shapes, text, and more


Performance Optimised

•Fast conversions even for high-resolution graphics

•Memory-efficient processing for large batches


Please leave some feedback if you find this plugin useful :)
plugins.tagline: Convert your designs to WebP - smaller files, same quality

plugins.name: Tag Filter
plugins.description:
Usage

You can show or hide specific layers in a batch.


How to use

Set “#TAG/{tag name}” as the layer name.


The tags you set will be listed in the plug-in window.


By selecting the tag you want to display, unselected tags will be hidden.



Ex: #TAG/SAMPLE01, #TAG/SAMPLE02, #TAG/SAMPLE03
plugins.tagline: This plugin allows you to show or hide layers by setting a specific tag as a layer name.

110111.name: Tag Filter
110111.description:
Usage

You can show or hide specific layers in a batch.


How to use

Set “#TAG/{tag name}” as the layer name.


The tags you set will be listed in the plug-in window.


By selecting the tag you want to display, unselected tags will be hidden.



Ex: #TAG/SAMPLE01, #TAG/SAMPLE02, #TAG/SAMPLE03
110111.tagline: This plugin allows you to show or hide layers by setting a specific tag as a layer name.

plugins.description: Color Tint Shades is designed to streamline color management. With it, you can instantly generate shades from any base color, allowing for a smooth transition between lighter and darker variations. This plugin is perfect for creating cohesive color palettes, enhancing UI elements, and ensuring consistency across your entire design system.
plugins.tagline: Instantly generate tints from any base color for smooth transitions between light and dark.

106739.description: Color Tint Shades is designed to streamline color management. This plugin is perfect for creating cohesive color palettes, enhancing UI elements, and ensuring consistency across your entire design system.

plugins.name: Local Variables Manipulator
plugins.description:
Local Variables Manipulator (LVM)

(Description in English)

  1. LVM is a Local Variables Exporter / Importer
  2. You can get data of Local Variables as JSON by Export.
  3. And you can update or insert Local Variables by using same format JSON.


(Description in Japanese)

  1. LVM は Local Variables の Exporter / Importer です。
  2. Local Variables の登録内容を JSON で Export できます。
  3. Export したものと同じ形式の JSON を使って Import できます。


Example JSON

{
"ColorExample": {
"Alias Token/primary": {
"$variableValues": {

plugins.tagline: Export / Import Local Variables

95541.name: Local Variables Manipulator
95541.description:
Local Variables Manipulator (LVM)

(Description in English)

  1. LVM is a Local Variables Exporter / Importer
  2. You can get data of Local Variables as JSON by Export.
  3. And you can update or insert Local Variables by using same format JSON.


(Description in Japanese)

  1. LVM は Local Variables の Exporter / Importer です。
  2. Local Variables の登録内容を JSON で Export できます。
  3. Export したものと同じ形式の JSON を使って Import できます。


Example JSON

{
"ColorExample": {
"Alias Token/primary": {
"$variableValues": {
"Light": "$Global Token/blue/100",
"Dark": "$Global Token/blue/100"
},
"$description": "",
"$codeSyntax": {
"WEB": "color.aliasToken.primary"
},
"$scopes": [
"ALL_SCOPES"
],
"$hiddenFromPublishing": false
},
"Global Token/blue/100": {
"$variableValues": {
"Light": "#0000FF",
"Dark": "#0000FF"
},
"$description": "",
"$codeSyntax": {
"WEB": "color.globalToken.blue['100']"
},
"$scopes": [
"ALL_SCOPES"
],
"$hiddenFromPublishing": false
}
}
}

Features:

Support: Feel free to share feedback or report issues in the comments or via email.

plugins.name: StackBlitz - design to instant dev environment in a click
plugins.description:
Implementing designs in code becomes much easier when you don't have to manually set up the environment, open and run the project, and search for the correct file. You can have all this work done for you by clicking a link!


How to use the plugin?

  • Make sure Dev Mode is on (⇧+D)
  • Select a layer
  • Open in the StackBlitz plugin and paste a URL of a repository with the code of your project. You can also use the URL of a specific file within this repository: typically, a component file, for instance: https://github.com/stackblitz/docs/blob/main/.vitepress/theme/components/CardLists/CardList.vue
  • Click the "Create instant environment link" button to have the link generated for the selected layer.


The link is now added to the layer's Dev resources.


When you click it, a new tab will open with the full IDE loaded with your project. If your link included a file, this file will already be open in the editor.


When to use it?

We suggest providing instant environment links, especially for the essential components in your app. The components that might need adjustments in future are good candidates as well.


Generally, every time a developer looks at a component in Figma to make changes in the code, having a resource link handy will make their work so much easier!
plugins.tagline: Select a layer and add a GitHub URL to get a reasource that opens a full development environment

77885.name: StackBlitz - design to instant dev environment in a click
77885.description:
Implementing designs in code becomes much easier when you don't have to manually set up the environment, open and run the project, and search for the correct file. You can have all this work done for you by clicking a link!


How to use the plugin?

  • Make sure Dev Mode is on (⇧+D)
  • Select a layer
  • Open in the StackBlitz plugin and paste a URL of a repository with the code of your project. You can also use the URL of a specific file within this repository: typically, a component file, for instance: https://github.com/stackblitz/docs/blob/main/.vitepress/theme/components/CardLists/CardList.vue
  • Click the "Create instant environment link" button to have the link generated for the selected layer.


The link is now added to the layer's Dev resources.


When you click it, a new tab will open with the full IDE loaded with your project. If your link included a file, this file will already be open in the editor.


When to use it?

We suggest providing instant environment links, especially for the essential components in your app. The components that might need adjustments in future are good candidates as well.


Generally, every time a developer looks at a component in Figma to make changes in the code, having a resource link handy will make their work so much easier!
77885.tagline: Select a layer and add a GitHub URL to get a reasource that opens a full development environment

plugins.name: Figma to Website(Powered by EdgeOne Pages)
plugins.description:
Convert your Figma designs into clean, responsive HTML code and publish them instantly to the web. This plugin bridges the gap between design and deployment.


Key Features:

• One-click code generation with Tailwind CSS styling

• Instant web publishing to EdgeOne Pages

• Responsive design preservation

• Real-time preview before publishing

• Copy-friendly code output


Perfect for designers, developers, and teams who need rapid design-to-web workflows for prototyping, landing pages, and showcasing interactive designs.


Based on the open-source Figma to Code project(https://github.com/bernaferrari/FigmaToCode), with hosting powered by EdgeOne Pages(https://edgeone.ai/products/pages).


Explore the source code at: https://github.com/TencentEdgeOne/figma-to-website
plugins.tagline: Transform your Figma designs into ready-to-deploy websites with one-click publishing

plugins.name: Flow Export PDF
plugins.description:
Easily export multiple Figma frames into a single PDF with clickable links! 🚀


How to Use:

1. Run the Plugin: Open the "uiexport" plugin.

2. Select Frames: Click and drag or Shift+click to select the frames you want to include in your PDF on the Figma canvas. 🖼️ The plugin window will show how many frames are selected.

3. Start Export: Click the "Export X Pages" button in the plugin window. ▶️

4. Processing: Wait while the plugin exports each frame and combines them into a PDF. You can track the progress (%) and see the status of each page (Exporting..., Processing PDF..., Completed). ⏳⚙️

5. Download: Once finished, the "Download PDF" button will appear. Click it to save your PDF file! 💾✅


✨ Features:

→ Exports multiple selected frames into one PDF.

→ Preserves clickable links (both URLs and links between exported frames). 🔗

→ Shows detailed progress and status for each frame.

→ Simple and clear interface.


Export your prototypes or presentations with interactive links effortlessly!
plugins.tagline: Interactive PDF exporter with multiple frames and clickable links.

plugins.name: Marvelous Avatars
plugins.description:
What You Can Expect from This Plugin

  1. Generate Unique Marvel Avatars: Easily create avatars featuring Marvel’s iconic characters for use in your designs, perfect for adding a heroic touch to user profiles, mockups, and more.
  2. Fill Shapes with Marvel Images: Instantly fill any shape in your Figma design with high-quality images from the Marvel universe, making your designs visually captivating and thematic.
  3. Marvel-Themed Lorem Ipsum: Replace standard placeholder text with fun and engaging Marvel data text, adding character and flair to your design mockups.
  4. Prefilled Data or Real-Time Fetching: Use the plugin’s prefilled Marvel data for quick access or connect your own Marvel Developer API credentials to fetch collections by name, randomly, or page by page, for the most up-to-date content.


Perfect for Designers Who

  1. Work on projects related to comics, superheroes, or fan sites.
  2. Want to bring a pop culture twist to their design work.
  3. Need unique placeholder content that stands out.
  4. With "Marvelous Avatars," you can quickly integrate Marvel’s universe into your Figma projects, enhancing your designs with iconic characters and stories.
plugins.tagline: Bring Marvel Universe to your Figma designs
